analyzed: 'phags pa yi ge drug pa'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Practice of the Noble Six Syllables

original: 'jig rten mgon po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Lord of the World.

original: dang por re zhig sngags pas gdong bkrus nas stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
analyzed: dang por re zhig sngags pas gdong bkrus nas stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
translated: First, the practitioner should wash their face and sit on a comfortable seat.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs par bsams la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs par bsams la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Contemplating the Buddha and so forth, they should go for refuge and so on.

original: bdag ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ba yin no zhes mos par byas nas /
analyzed: bdag ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ba yin no zhes mos par byas nas /
translated: Having imagined, I have gone for refuge to the Three Jewels,

original: sems can ji snyed sems can du bsdu bas yang dang bar bsdus pa /🔽sgo nga las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: sems can ji snyed sems can du bsdu bas yang dang bar bsdus pa / sgo nga las skyes pa'am /
translated: they should think, As many sentient beings as there are, included in the category of sentient beings,🔽whether born from eggs,

original: mngal las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: mngal las skyes pa'am /
translated: born from wombs,

original: drod gsher las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: drod gsher las skyes pa'am /
translated: born from heat and moisture,

original: rdzus te skyes pa'am /🔽gzugs can nam /
analyzed: rdzus te skyes pa'am / gzugs can nam /
translated: or born miraculously,

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'am /
translated: whether having form or formless,

original: 'du shes can nam /🔽'du shes med pa'am /
analyzed: 'du shes can nam / 'du shes med pa'am /
translated: whether having perception,🔽without perception,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min te /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min te /
translated: or neither with nor without perception,

original: ji srid du sems can ni khams gsum du gdags pas /
analyzed: ji srid du sems can ni khams gsum du gdags pas /
translated: as long as sentient beings are designated in the three realms,

original: btags pa de dag thams cad bdag nyid kyis phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su dgod par bya'o zhes bsam /
analyzed: btags pa de dag thams cad bdag nyid kyis phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su dgod par bya'o zhes bsam /
translated: I will myself establish all of these imputations in the sphere of reality without remainder.

original: de nas aom sva bh'a ba bi shuddha:sarbba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba bi shuddhonya\ham /
analyzed: de nas aom sva bh'a ba bi shuddha:sarbba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba bi shuddhonya\ham /
translated: Then, recite: Oṃ svabhāva viśuddhaḥ sarvadharma svabhāva viśuddho ’haṃ.

original: de nas stong ba nyid du bsdu bas bsdus pa tsam gyis bsgoms la /
analyzed: de nas stong ba nyid du bsdu bas bsdus pa tsam gyis bsgoms la /
translated: Then, meditate on the mere gathering of emptiness.

original: de'i 'og tu rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i steng du yi ge hr'i: las 'od zer brgya stong 'byung bar bsgoms te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i steng du yi ge hr'i: las 'od zer brgya stong 'byung bar bsgoms te /
translated: After that, in one’s heart is a moon maṇḍala. Upon that, from hṛīḥ, one should meditate on the arising of hundreds of thousands of light rays.

original: yang de nyid kyis thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa mtha' dag rnam par dag par byas nas bdag nyid kyi snying gar zhugs pa las /
analyzed: yang de nyid kyis thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa mtha' dag rnam par dag par byas nas bdag nyid kyi snying gar zhugs pa las /
translated: Again, with that, all of one’s afflictions, such as desire, and so on, accumulated since beginningless time, are completely purified and enter one’s heart.

original: bdag nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sku rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sku rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: From that, one arises in the form of Lokeśvara, adorned with all ornaments,

original: sku mdog dkar po phyag bzhi pa g-yas na bgrang phreng g-yon na padma bsnams pa /
analyzed: sku mdog dkar po phyag bzhi pa g-yas na bgrang phreng g-yon na padma bsnams pa /
translated: white in color, with four arms, holding a rosary in the right hands and a lotus in the left hands,

original: gzhan gnyis kyis thugs kar thal mo sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gnyis kyis thugs kar thal mo sbyar ba'o //
translated: The other two have their palms joined at the heart.

original: g-yas su nor bu 'dzin pa sku mdog dang phyag la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: g-yas su nor bu 'dzin pa sku mdog dang phyag la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: To the right is Ratnapāṇi, whose color, hands, and so forth are the same.

original: g-yon du 'bru drug pa'i rig pa chen mo phyag bzhi pa ston ka'i sprin lta bu'o //
analyzed: g-yon du 'bru drug pa'i rig pa chen mo phyag bzhi pa ston ka'i sprin lta bu'o //
translated: To the left is the great six-syllable awareness, four-handed, like an autumn cloud.

original: de nas aom ma h'a su kha badzra sa tva /
analyzed: de nas aom ma h'a su kha badzra sa tva /
translated: Then one should recite the mantra king of consecration:

original: dza:h'um bam ho:su ra ta stvam /
analyzed: dza:h'um bam ho:su ra ta stvam /
translated: oṃ mahāsukha vajrasattva🔽jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ suratas tvam

original: aa la la la la ho //
analyzed: aa la la la la ho //
translated: a la la la la ho

original: aa aa aa aa zhes bya bas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags kyi rgyal po brjod @195b par bya'o //
analyzed: aa aa aa aa zhes bya bas byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags kyi rgyal po brjod @195b par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the king of mantras of consecration, a ā ā ā ā.

original: de ltar bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu 'jig rten dbang phyug gi thugs kar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la phreng ba 'dra ba dkar po zhal nas byung zhing lte bar byugs te 'khor lo 'khor ba'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rtog pa'i
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu 'jig rten dbang phyug gi thugs kar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la phreng ba 'dra ba dkar po zhal nas byung zhing lte bar byugs te 'khor lo 'khor ba'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rtog pa'i
translated: Having meditated in that way, then at the heart of Lokeśvara, on a moon mandala, is a garland like a rosary, white, emerging from the mouth and touching the navel, revolving like a wheel, the wish-fulfilling gem of all buddhas.

original: sngags kyi rgyal po 'di mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi rgyal po 'di mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this king of mantras in a signless manner.

original: de nas lus g-yo ba dang bcas pa la sogs par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa dad pa dang snying rje dang / bla ma la gus pa dang ldan pas ni ring po mi thogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas lus g-yo ba dang bcas pa la sogs par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa dad pa dang snying rje dang / bla ma la gus pa dang ldan pas ni ring po mi thogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the yogi who has faith, compassion, and respect for the guru, whose body becomes endowed with shaking and so forth, will be accomplished before long.

original: aom ma ni padme h'um zhes de ltar bzla'o //
analyzed: aom ma ni padme h'um zhes de ltar bzla'o //
translated: One should recite like this: Om mani padme hum.

original: de nas ldang ba'i dus su sngags 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ldang ba'i dus su sngags 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, at the time of rising, one should recite this mantra:
